intro: Verbesina carranzae, commonly known as Carranza's beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a small capsule containing numerous seeds. Verbesina carranzae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
